    • Method Detail

      • replace

        public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String pattern,
                                       java.lang.String subject,
                                       ReplaceCallback.Callback callback)
        Replaces with callback, with no limit to the number of replacements. Probably what you want most of the time.

      • replace

        public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String pattern,
                                       java.lang.String subject,
                                       int limit,
                                       ReplaceCallback.Callback callback)

      • replace

        public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String regex,
                                       java.lang.String subject,
                                       int limit,
                                       java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger count,
                                       ReplaceCallback.Callback callback)
        Parameters:
        regex - The regular expression pattern to search on.
        subject - The string to be replaced.
        limit - The maximum number of replacements to make. A negative value indicates replace all.
        count - If this is not null, it will be set to the number of replacements made.
        callback - Callback function
